services.name: Renewable Asset Predictive Maintenance AI
services.overview: The Renewable Asset Predictive Maintenance AI is a comprehensive platform designed to minimize downtime and maximize energy production for renewable energy assets. It leverages machine learning to analyze sensor data from wind turbines, solar inverters, and other critical equipment, enabling proactive identification and mitigation of potential failures. By predicting equipment malfunctions before they occur, the platform empowers O&M teams to schedule maintenance efficiently, reduce unplanned outages, lower operational costs, and extend the lifespan of valuable assets. This platform directly addresses the challenges of unexpected equipment failures, leading to optimized energy output and improved profitability for renewable energy operators.
problems_addressed: Unexpected equipment failures leading to costly downtime.
Reduced energy output due to unplanned outages.
Inefficient maintenance scheduling and resource allocation.
Increased operational costs associated with reactive maintenance.
Shortened asset lifespan due to undetected equipment degradation.
target_users: O&M Technicians – who use the platform to identify potential issues and schedule maintenance tasks.
Asset Managers – who monitor overall asset health and performance and make strategic maintenance decisions.
Plant Operators – who oversee day-to-day operations and respond to alerts generated by the platform.
core_features: Real-time Sensor Data Ingestion – Securely collects and processes sensor data (vibration, temperature, oil analysis, SCADA data) from various renewable energy assets.
Predictive Failure Modeling – Employs machine learning algorithms to analyze sensor data and predict the likelihood of future equipment failures, providing estimated time-to-failure predictions.
Automated Anomaly Detection – Identifies unusual patterns and deviations in sensor data that may indicate potential issues, triggering alerts for further investigation.
Maintenance Scheduling Optimization – Recommends optimal maintenance schedules based on predicted failure probabilities, minimizing downtime and maximizing resource utilization.
Performance Monitoring and Reporting – Provides comprehensive dashboards and reports on asset health, performance, and maintenance activities, enabling data-driven decision-making.
user_journeys: An O&M technician logs into the platform, views the dashboard, and sees a high-probability failure prediction for a wind turbine gearbox bearing. The platform recommends replacing the bearing within the next two weeks. The technician schedules the replacement during the next planned maintenance window, avoiding a costly unplanned outage.
ai_capabilities: Time Series Forecasting: Uses Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) like LSTMs and GRUs to predict future sensor values based on historical data. Model selection will prioritize those that perform best on minimizing RMSE and MAE during validation. Frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch will be used.

Anomaly Detection: Employs One-Class SVM or Isolation Forest to identify unusual data points that deviate from normal operating conditions. The chosen algorithm will be optimized for detecting subtle anomalies that precede equipment failures. Scikit-learn will be used.

Failure Classification: Utilizes supervised learning algorithms like Random Forest or Gradient Boosting Machines (XGBoost, LightGBM) to classify potential failure types based on sensor data patterns. Fine-tuning using Bayesian optimization will be employed to optimize model performance.

The platform will leverage transfer learning, using pre-trained models on similar industrial datasets to accelerate model training and improve accuracy. Fine-tuning on the specific renewable energy asset data will be crucial.

input_data_types: Oil analysis data (viscosity, wear debris, contaminants)
SCADA data (power output, wind speed, generator speed)
data_schema_recommendations: Sensor readings: timestamp (TIMESTAMP), asset_id (VARCHAR), sensor_type (VARCHAR), reading_value (FLOAT)
Maintenance events: event_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), asset_id (VARCHAR), event_type (VARCHAR), start_time (TIMESTAMP), end_time (TIMESTAMP), description (TEXT)
Asset metadata: asset_id (VARCHAR, PRIMARY KEY), asset_type (VARCHAR), manufacturer (VARCHAR), model (VARCHAR), installation_date (DATE)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) regarding the collection, storage, and processing of sensor data. Implement appropriate data encryption and access control measures.

required_integrations: SCADA Systems: Integrate with existing SCADA systems to ingest real-time operational data.
CMMS: Integrate with maintenance management systems to streamline maintenance workflows and track maintenance activities.
Email Providers: Integrate with email providers (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) to send notifications and alerts to O&M personnel.
Analytics Tools: Integrate with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) to track platform usage and user engagement.
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: Implement JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for secure authentication and authorization. Consider integrating with Clerk or Auth0 for simplified user management and authentication workflows.

technical_specifications.architecture: The platform will follow a microservices architecture, consisting of an API layer, a frontend, a backend, a database, and an AI pipeline. The API layer will expose RESTful endpoints for accessing data and triggering AI models. The frontend will provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring asset health and managing maintenance activities. The backend will handle data processing, model training, and API requests. The database will store sensor data, maintenance records, and model predictions. The AI pipeline will ingest sensor data, preprocess it, and run machine learning models to generate predictions.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions. Utilizes server components for data fetching and rendering.
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions for API endpoints and background tasks.
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with TimescaleDB extension for efficient time-series data storage.
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing large sensor data files and model artifacts.
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API for text analysis of maintenance logs (if needed). Embeddings for semantic search of similar failure events. Vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors) for storing and querying embeddings.
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST APIs for communication between frontend, backend, and AI services.
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub → Vercel automatic deploy pipeline for continuous integration and deployment.

API_design: GET /assets: Returns a list of all assets.
GET /assets/{asset_id}: Returns detailed information about a specific asset.
GET /assets/{asset_id}/sensors: Returns a list of sensors associated with an asset.
GET /assets/{asset_id}/sensors/{sensor_id}/data: Returns sensor data for a specific sensor within a specified time range (e.g., last 24 hours, last week).
GET /assets/{asset_id}/predictions: Returns failure predictions for a specific asset.
POST /assets/{asset_id}/maintenance: Creates a new maintenance event for a specific asset.
frontend_components: Asset Dashboard: Displays key performance indicators (KPIs) and asset health metrics.
Sensor Data Visualization: Provides interactive charts and graphs for visualizing sensor data.
Failure Prediction Alerts: Displays alerts for predicted equipment failures.
Maintenance Scheduling Tool: Enables users to schedule maintenance tasks and track their progress.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, SENSOR_DATA_API_KEY.
Vercel deployment steps: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables in Vercel settings. Enable automatic deployments on Git push.
Build outputs: Next.js static files for the frontend. Serverless functions for the backend API.
Runtime settings: Node.js runtime for the backend. Cron jobs for scheduling AI model training.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Basic, Standard, Premium. Tiered pricing based on the number of assets monitored, the frequency of data ingestion, and the level of support provided.
Usage-based pricing: Charge per sensor reading or per prediction generated.
Add-ons: Offer additional features such as customized reporting, advanced analytics, and on-site consulting as add-ons.
customer_segments: Small businesses: Independent wind or solar farm operators.
Enterprises: Large utility companies with diverse renewable energy portfolios.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Reduction in unplanned downtime (%), increase in energy production (%), reduction in maintenance costs (%).
AI performance KPIs: Prediction accuracy (precision, recall, F1-score), time-to-failure prediction horizon (days/weeks).
Adoption/engagement KPIs: Number of active users, frequency of platform usage, user satisfaction (Net Promoter Score).
